column5: Please note, we plan to deliver our Health Policy courses in a multi-mode format, meaning a combination of on-campus (in-person) teaching and remote (online) teaching.If this does happen, applicants will be contacted, explained any changes to the programme structure and offered the opportunity to consider their application. Find out more about how we will tell you about changes.Our courses in Health Policy offer you the chance to learn about important aspects of health policy from leading international academics and practitioners.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 25 months part-time (MSc), 22-23 months part-time (PG Dip), 10-11 months part-time (PGCert)
